threat: It was discovered that a heap overflow in the AWT FileDialog.show() method could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service through an application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.

It was dicovered that integer overflows in the JPEGImageReader readImage() function and the SunLayoutEngine nativeLayout() function could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service through an application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.
This could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service through an application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.
This could allow an attacker to possibly execute code with elevated privileges.
This could give an attacker more information about the networking environment.
This could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service through an application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.
This could possibly allow an attacker access to restricted resources or services.
This could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
After a standard system update you need to restart any Java services,
applications or applets to make all the necessary changes.
